revised_title: Alexander John Ellis: A Pioneering Scholar in Mathematics, Phonetics, and Music
tldr: Alexander John Ellis was a versatile and accomplished scholar who made significant contributions to mathematics, phonetics, and music. He translated and expanded on Professor Helmholtz's work on the sensations of tone, published numerous papers on mathematical subjects, and advocated for phonetic spelling reform. Ellis also studied early English pronunciation and authored a comprehensive work on the subject.
